title: Unit 10 Checkpoint: Infinite Sequences & Series
description: Summative checkpoint assessing convergence of sequences/series, convergence tests (nth-term, geometric, p-series, comparison, ratio, alternating), Taylor/Maclaurin polynomials, power series interval of convergence, and Lagrange error bound. BC-exclusive, 17–18% of AP exam weight.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Sequence converges if limit exists and is finite; use L'Hôpital, squeeze, or algebraic techniques; nth-term test: if lim aₙ≠0 → series DIVERGES (converse FALSE)
Geometric: Σarⁿ converges iff |r|<1, sum=a/(1−r); p-series: Σ1/nᵖ converges iff p>1; telescoping: partial fractions then collapse
Decision tree: factorials/exponentials→ratio test; compare to known series→comparison/limit comparison; integral test for monotone decreasing; ratio test inconclusive when L=1
AST: (−1)ⁿbₙ converges if bₙ↓0; error bound |S−Sₙ|≤|a_{n+1}|=b_{n+1}; absolute conv: Σ|aₙ| converges; conditional: Σaₙ converges but Σ|aₙ| diverges
Pₙ(x)=Σf⁽ᵏ⁾(a)(x−a)ᵏ/k!; compute derivatives at center; Maclaurin=Taylor at a=0; general term pattern
MEMORIZE: eˣ=Σxⁿ/n!, sinx=Σ(−1)ⁿx²ⁿ⁺¹/(2n+1)!, cosx=Σ(−1)ⁿx²ⁿ/(2n)!, 1/(1−x)=Σxⁿ; build new series by substitution, differentiation, integration
Ratio test to find R; interval (a−R,a+R); CHECK EACH ENDPOINT separately (may converge at one, diverge at other); term-by-term differentiation/integration preserves R (not necessarily endpoints)
|Rₙ(x)|≤M|x−a|ⁿ⁺¹/(n+1)! where M=max|f⁽ⁿ⁺¹⁾| on interval; find M then plug in; for alternating series use ASET instead if applicable

assessmentProblems.question: Determine whether each series converges or diverges: (a) Σ_{n=1}^∞ n/(2n+1), (b) Σ_{n=1}^∞ 3(1/4)ⁿ, (c) Σ_{n=1}^∞ 1/n³.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) lim n/(2n+1) = 1/2 ≠ 0 → diverges by nth-term test. (b) Geometric with r = 1/4, |r| < 1 → converges. Sum = 3(1/4)/(1−1/4) = (3/4)/(3/4) = 1. (c) p-series with p = 3 > 1 → converges.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the sum of the telescoping series Σ_{n=1}^∞ [1/n − 1/(n+1)].
Determine convergence: Σ_{n=1}^∞ n²/3ⁿ.
assessmentProblems.answer: Ratio test: a_{n+1}/aₙ = [(n+1)²/3ⁿ⁺¹]·[3ⁿ/n²] = (n+1)²/(3n²). L = lim (n+1)²/(3n²) = 1/3 < 1 → converges.

assessmentProblems.question: Determine convergence: Σ_{n=2}^∞ 1/(n·ln(n)).
assessmentProblems.answer: Integral test: ∫₂^∞ 1/(x·ln(x)) dx. Let u = ln(x), du = 1/x dx. ∫ = ∫_{ln2}^∞ 1/u du = [ln|u|]_{ln2}^∞ = ∞. Diverges.

assessmentProblems.question: Does Σ_{n=1}^∞ (−1)ⁿ⁺¹/n converge absolutely, conditionally, or diverge?
assessmentProblems.answer: Alternating series: bₙ = 1/n, which is decreasing and bₙ → 0 → converges by AST. But Σ|aₙ| = Σ1/n = harmonic series → diverges. Therefore, conditionally convergent.

assessmentProblems.question: Use the alternating series error bound to estimate Σ_{n=0}^∞ (−1)ⁿ/(2n+1)! using the first 3 nonzero terms, and give a bound on the error.
Find the first four nonzero terms of the Maclaurin series for f(x) = eˣ·sin(x).
Find the Maclaurin series for f(x) = x²·cos(x) through the x⁶ term.
assessmentProblems.answer: cos(x) = 1 − x²/2 + x⁴/24 − x⁶/720 + ⋯. Multiply by x²: x²·cos(x) = x² − x⁴/2 + x⁶/24 − ⋯. Through x⁶: x² − x⁴/2 + x⁶/24.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the interval of convergence for Σ_{n=1}^∞ (x−3)ⁿ/(n·2ⁿ).
assessmentProblems.answer: Ratio test: |a_{n+1}/aₙ| = |x−3|ⁿ⁺¹/((n+1)·2ⁿ⁺¹) · (n·2ⁿ)/|x−3|ⁿ = (n/(n+1))·|x−3|/2. L = |x−3|/2. Converges when |x−3|/2 < 1 → |x−3| < 2 → 1 < x < 5. R = 2. Check x=1: Σ(−1)ⁿ/n = alternating harmonic → converges (conditionally). Check x=5: Σ1/n = harmonic → diverges. Interval: [1, 5).

assessmentProblems.question: Use the third-degree Taylor polynomial for eˣ centered at a = 0 to approximate e^(0.5). Then use the Lagrange error bound to find a bound on the error.

ANALYSIS: The function f has derivatives of all orders, and the Maclaurin series for f is Σ_{n=0}^∞ (−1)ⁿ x²ⁿ⁺¹/(2n+1). (a) Identify f(x). (b) Find the radius of convergence. (c) Use the first three nonzero terms to approximate f(1/2) and bound the error.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) This is the Maclaurin series for arctan(x): arctan(x) = Σ_{n=0}^∞ (−1)ⁿx²ⁿ⁺¹/(2n+1) = x − x³/3 + x⁵/5 − ⋯. (b) Ratio test: |a_{n+1}/aₙ| = |x|²ⁿ⁺³/(2n+3) · (2n+1)/|x|²ⁿ⁺¹ = (2n+1)/(2n+3)·x². L = x². Converges when x² < 1 → |x| < 1, so R = 1. (c) f(1/2) ≈ 1/2 − (1/2)³/3 + (1/2)⁵/5 = 1/2 − 1/24 + 1/160. Common denominator 480: 240/480 − 20/480 + 3/480 = 223/480 ≈ 0.4646. This is alternating and |terms| decrease, so error ≤ |first omitted| = (1/2)⁷/7 = 1/896 ≈ 0.00112. (Actual: arctan(1/2) ≈ 0.4636.)

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Polar Area): Find the area enclosed by the cardioid r = 1 + cos(θ).
SPIRAL (Washer Method): Find the volume when the region bounded by y = x² and y = 2x is revolved about the x-axis.
spiralReview.answer: Intersections: x²=2x → x(x−2)=0 → x=0,2. On [0,2]: 2x≥x² (outer=2x, inner=x²). V = π∫₀²[(2x)²−(x²)²]dx = π∫₀²(4x²−x⁴)dx = π[4x³/3−x⁵/5]₀² = π(32/3−32/5) = π(160/15−96/15) = 64π/15.
